alt_statements.statement: If you want people to stop littering, you’ve got to make it their responsibility, not just pass another feel‑good law. Keep the rules simple and enforced with real fines, put out plenty of trash and recycling cans where people actually are, and make businesses partly responsible for keeping the areas around their properties clean. I’d rather see community clean‑up days, school projects, and local campaigns that appeal to pride and common sense than more government micromanaging where every little mistake turns into a ticket.

As someone who spends a lot of time outside, volunteering and caring about sustainable living, I think the best way to prevent littering is to make it easy not to litter—like having plenty of clearly marked trash and recycling bins and keeping them well maintained. On top of that, there should be real fines for littering that are actually enforced, plus public education campaigns that connect clean public spaces with community pride and environmental impact. I’d also love to see local businesses, especially restaurants like where I work, take responsibility by reducing single-use packaging and sponsoring clean-up days.

As someone who spends a lot of time outdoors sketching and finding inspiration in parks and city streets, it breaks my heart to see trash scattered where beauty should be. I think we need a mix of practical steps—like plenty of accessible trash and recycling bins, regular clean-up crews, and meaningful fines for repeat offenders—along with public art and education campaigns that make people feel proud of keeping shared spaces clean. I’d especially love to see community-led projects and school programs that involve kids in caring for their neighborhoods, because when people feel a sense of ownership and connection, they’re far less likely to litter in the first place.

Having worked in healthcare, I’ve seen firsthand how a dirty environment can impact both physical and mental well-being, so I believe we need a mix of strict enforcement and practical support to keep public spaces clean.
